meanings.definition: The number of people attending or taking part in an event or activity.
meanings.sent1: The turnout for the concert was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The turnout at the rally was higher than expected.
meanings.sent3: The turnout for the bake sale left us with no more cookies!
meanings.sent4: The turnout at the meeting was so large, it spilled out into the hallway.
meanings.sent5: The turnout for the race was so massive, it felt like the whole town was there.

meanings.definition: The act of turning out or the process of turning out.
meanings.sent1: The turnout of the students from the school was organized.
meanings.sent2: The turnout of the production crew was swift and efficient.
meanings.sent3: The turnout of the cake from the pan was perfect, no sticking!
meanings.sent4: The turnout of events led to a successful outcome.
meanings.sent5: The turnout of the key in the lock was smooth and easy.

meanings.definition: The space required for a vehicle to turn around.
meanings.sent1: The narrow street had a tight turnout for cars.
meanings.sent2: The driver had to find a wide turnout to make the U-turn.
meanings.sent3: The turnout for the car was so small, it took multiple attempts to maneuver.
meanings.sent4: The turnout in the parking lot was limited, causing traffic congestion.
meanings.sent5: The turnout on the mountain road was a challenge for large trucks.
